cities.name: Atlanta

permits.description: Required health permit for all mobile food service operations in Fulton County
permits.costNotes: Ranges from $450-$750 depending on risk level

permits.description: One-time plan review for new mobile food units
Required for operating in City of Atlanta public right-of-way locations
permits.issuingAgency: City of Atlanta Office of Revenue

permits.description: City of Atlanta business license for food truck operations
permits.issuingAgency: City of Atlanta Office of Revenue

restrictions: Must be 200 feet from eating establishments or 100 feet from food-selling retail stores unless owner permission obtained
Cannot be within 25 feet of any right-of-way, entryway, or curb-cut
Must operate from designated locations in Street Eats Atlanta program
notes: Fulton County requirements may differ from City of Atlanta requirements
Food trucks serving prepared/unpackaged foods have stricter requirements than pre-packaged vendors
Street Eats Atlanta program designates specific vending locations

cities.name: Nashville

permits.description: Health permit for mobile food units in Davidson County
Required for operating in public right-of-way locations
Special permit for operating in Metro Parks locations
requirements: $1,000,000 liability insurance naming Metro Parks as additionally insured

permits.description: Davidson County business license

healthDept.name: Metro Nashville Public Health Department - Food Protection Division

restrictions: Must not block pedestrian or vehicular traffic
Distance requirements from brick-and-mortar restaurants may apply
Specific operating hours in designated locations
Mobile Food Vendor Pilot Program has designated zones
notes: BL2024-391 legislation authorizes NDOT to regulate mobile food vending in public right-of-way
Fair and festival operations may have different requirements
Commissary agreement required for food storage and preparation

cities.name: Las Vegas

permits.description: Health permit required for all mobile food operations in Clark County
permits.costNotes: Plan review and permit fees combined; approximately $500 one-time

permits.description: City of Las Vegas business license for food truck operations
permits.issuingAgency: City of Las Vegas Business Licensing
permits.costNotes: $100 initial fee + $50 application fee; renewal based on revenue
requirements: Liability insurance naming City of Las Vegas as additional insured

permits.description: Annual fire safety inspection for food trucks
permits.issuingAgency: City of Las Vegas Fire Prevention Division

healthDept.name: Southern Nevada Health District - Environmental Health

restrictions: Cannot disconnect trailer/portable unit except in emergency
Open Air Food Vending license needed for single location more than 4 hours
Disturbed area cannot exceed 5,000 square feet
Must comply with Clark County air quality standards

opportunities.foodTruckThursdays: Every other Thursday at Las Vegas Civic Center, 11am-1pm
opportunities.mobileFoodTruckLottery: Designated downtown parking spaces; lottery held January and July

notes: Renewal fees based on semi-annual revenue per city fee schedule
Missed appointment fee of $239 if less than 24 hours notice
Environmental Compliance team assists with waste disposal compliance

cities.name: Philadelphia

permits.type: Food Establishment Retail, Non-Permanent Location License
permits.description: Required license for food trucks, movable stands, and carts
permits.issuingAgency: Philadelphia Department of Licenses and Inspections
permits.costNotes: $20 non-refundable application fee applied toward license fee

permits.description: Plan review required before operating a mobile food business
permits.issuingAgency: Philadelphia Department of Licenses and Inspections
requirements: City of Philadelphia Food Safety Certificate

restrictions: Must have Annual License Eligibility Report from Philadelphia Department of Health for renewal
Late renewal (60+ days) incurs 1.5% monthly fee
notes: License can be renewed online through eCLIPSE system
Food safety certified staff must attend inspection with photo ID
$500,000 limit for online payments

cities.name: San Antonio

permits.description: Health permit for mobile food operations

permits.type: Fire Department Mobile Food Booth Certification
permits.description: Fire safety inspection and certification for mobile food units
permits.issuingAgency: San Antonio Fire Department - Fire Prevention Division

healthDept.name: San Antonio Metropolitan Health District - Food Licensing
healthDept.inspectionSchedule: Tuesdays and Thursdays, 8:00 AM - 10:00 AM (appointment required)

restrictions: Permit specifies type of food, manner of vending, and vehicle description
Designated vending locations include Main Plaza, Travis Park, Soledad Street, Madison Park
notes: Mobile food vending inspections by appointment only
Texas Department of State Health Services handles food manufacturer licenses
Check local code for distance requirements from restaurants

cities.name: Orlando

permits.type: State Mobile Food Dispensing Vehicle License
permits.description: Florida state license required for all mobile food operations
permits.issuingAgency: Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services (FDACS)
permits.costNotes: Free permit with application; must meet inspection requirements

permits.type: City of Orlando Business Tax Receipt
permits.description: Required to operate a mobile business within Orlando city limits
permits.costNotes: Based on business type and revenue

healthDept.name: Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services

restrictions: One vendor per zoning lot (private property)
Cannot interfere with required parking or loading spaces
Not allowed on residential property
Located on paved parking area
Cannot damage required landscaping
Cannot be within 5 feet of right-of-way
cities.operatingHours: 6 AM to midnight (unless approved event has different hours)
notes: Mobile Retail Trucks regulated similarly to food trucks
Permanent food truck pods allow 7 days/week operation
City-approved special events may have different requirements
Contact City Planning at 407.246.2269 for questions

cities.name: Minneapolis

permits.description: City license required for food truck operations in Minneapolis
Required plan review for new food trucks and remodels

healthDept.name: Minneapolis Health Department - Environmental Health
healthDept.inspectionAddress: Public Service Building, 505 Fourth Ave. S., Room 520

restrictions: Food preparation and storage must occur at licensed Minneapolis kitchen
Food trucks may not operate more than 21 days annually at any one location (MN Statute 157.15)
Trucks must be removed daily when operation ends
Letter of approval required if near a park, restaurant, or on private property
operatingLocations: Community events and farmers markets (written permission required)
notes: See map of approved street locations on city website
Green To Go ordinance compliance may be required
Short-term and seasonal food permits available for event-only operations

cities.name: Tampa

permits.type: State Mobile Food Dispensing Vehicle License
permits.description: Florida Division of Hotels and Restaurants license
permits.issuingAgency: Florida Department of Business & Professional Regulation (DBPR)

permits.description: City or County business tax receipt
Fire safety permit for food truck operations
requirements: Commercial hood with fire suppression (if cooking)
Class K extinguisher (if cooking produces grease vapors)

permits.description: Required for operating on private property adjacent to special events

healthDept.name: Florida Division of Hotels and Restaurants

restrictions: One vendor per zoning lot
Cannot interfere with required parking or loading spaces
Not allowed on residential property
Must have property owner notarized permission for private property
requiredDocuments: General and Automotive Liability insurance with policy number
notes: Public right-of-way vendors must comply with Chapter 28 regulations
Fire Marshal may inspect at any time during operation
Proof of commissary association required

cities.name: Charlotte

permits.description: Health permit for mobile food operations
permits.costNotes: $75 per food service permit for temporary/event operations

permits.description: City of Charlotte business license
permits.issuingAgency: City of Charlotte Business Privilege License Office

permits.description: Permit for operating in designated street vendor locations

restrictions: Must comply with Mecklenburg County Health Department regulations
Non-permitted vendors cannot prepare food on site
Street Vendor Program has designated locations
notes: Applications can be mailed, faxed, or submitted in person
3205 Freedom Dr Suite 8000 J, Charlotte NC 28208

cities.name: Boston

permits.description: City of Boston food truck operating permit
permits.issuingAgency: City of Boston Office of Small Business Development
requirements: Fire department permit (if using open flame/propane)

permits.description: Required if using open flame or propane

healthDept.name: Boston Public Health Commission - Inspectional Services

restrictions: All retail food vendors must purchase items from a wholesaler
Canteen trucks require hand washing facilities, mechanical refrigeration, and hot holding equipment

officeInfo.address: Office of Small Business, Food Truck Coordinator, 43 Hawkins Street, Boston, MA 02114
officeInfo.permitPickup: 1 City Hall Square, Room 714, Boston City Hall

notes: Public site lottery held periodically - notified after permit approval
Check payable to City of Boston
Can apply online, in person, or by email

cities.name: Columbus

permits.description: City of Columbus license for food trucks, trailers, and push carts
permits.issuingAgency: Columbus Department of Public Safety - License Section
requirements: State of Ohio Health Food Service License
Letter of good standing from Income Tax
documents: Insurance certificate ($300K min for pushcarts, $1M for trucks)

permits.description: One-time application processing fee
Optional license for operating on city streets and sidewalks
Health inspection and food service license

restrictions: Ohio Department of Agriculture registration required for food processing
Stock trucks providing additional storage must be inspected

officeInfo.address: License Section, 4252 Groves Rd, Columbus, OH 43232
officeInfo.dropBox: After hours drop box on south side of building

notes: StreetFoodFinder booking system for PROW spots
License emailed upon approval
Contact CRISP help line at 614-645-8899 for tax questions

cities.name: Indianapolis

permits.description: License for operating food trucks in Marion County
permits.issuingAgency: Indianapolis Department of Business and Neighborhood Services (BNS)

permits.description: Health permit for mobile food operations
Required for mobile units not licensed in Marion County attending events
permits.costNotes: Must be obtained at least 48 hours prior to event
requirements: Valid health permit from home county

restrictions: Non-Marion County licensed mobile units need temporary food license for events
Minimum 48 hours notice for temporary permits
notes: Mobile Vendor License different from Transient Merchant License
Contact BNS for specific fee schedule
Indiana requires mobile food truck (MFT) permit and commissary agreement
